title: SIR battle in Bengal: Mamata writes to CEC; calls survey 'chaotic, dangerous'
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has described the ongoing Special Intensive Revision as "unplanned, chaotic, and dangerous," citing the deaths of multiple booth-level officers. She expressed grave concerns to the CEC about the alarming situation, alleging a lack of preparedness and pushing BLOs beyond human limits, risking voter roll credibility.

title: 'Guv's can't sit on bills but ... ': What SC said on presidential reference - key points
content: Governors cannot indefinitely delay Bills passed by state legislatures, the Supreme Court ruled, emphasizing cooperative federalism. However, courts cannot set hard deadlines for governors or the President on Bills, nor can they grant 'deemed assent' or compel the President to seek judicial opinions. The ruling clarifies the limits of judicial intervention while upholding constitutional accountability.

title: How Anti-India hate went mainstream in America - offline and online
content: A community once welcomed as quiet achievers is now facing a bipartisan backlash, as anti-India hate jumps from online narratives to real-world hostility in a country still misreading Indians five centuries after Columbus.

title: Delhi blast case: Shaheen among 4 accused sent to 10-day NIA custody
content: Four individuals, including doctors from Pulwama and Saharanpur, have been remanded to 10 days NIA custody in connection with the Red Fort blast. Investigators believe they played a significant role in planning and executing the attack, which claimed 15 lives. The probe has expanded internationally, involving Saudi Arabia, Maldives, and Turkey.

title: Jeff Bezos warns of recession: Amazon founder issues caution
content: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos is urging consumers and businesses to delay major purchases amid growing recession fears. He advises households to save for big-ticket items like cars and appliances, while small businesses should avoid large capital expenditures.  Despite this caution, Bezos remains optimistic about the long-term American Dream and future space travel accessibility.

title: 'No one wanted': Batting coach contradicts Gambhir; hits out at Kolkata wicket
content: India's batting coach Sitanshu Kotak strongly defended head coach Gautam Gambhir against criticism following the Kolkata Test loss to South Africa. "'Gautam Gambhir, Gautam Gambhir' (criticism) is being done. I am saying this because I am a staff and I feel bad. That's not the way," Kotak said on Thursday ahead of the second Test starting Saturday.

title: Delhi blast: Red Fort gears up for first mega event; Prez Murmu & Shah may attend
content: The historic Red Fort is set to host a major event commemorating the 350th death anniversary of Guru Tegh Bahadur, with security significantly heightened following a recent car blast. The three-day kirtan darbar, expected to draw nearly 50,000 attendees including dignitaries, will feature a multi-layer security grid and enhanced surveillance.

title: Chip race: Semiconductor sector will be on par with US by 2032, says Vaishnaw
content: India aims to rival global chipmaking leaders like the US and China within a decade, with plans advancing rapidly. The government's $10 billion incentive scheme is foundational, fostering manufacturing, assembly, and design capacity. By 2031-2032, India expects to achieve parity with current global leaders, leveraging its engineering talent and design capabilities.

title: Nvidia’s $100 bn ‘U-Turn’: OpenAI deal not confirmed yet; sends reminder to investors
content: Nvidia clarified to investors that its $100 billion investment in OpenAI is not a finalized contract, despite a prior announcement. The chipmaker emphasized that definitive agreements are not assured, highlighting the difference between an announcement and a signed deal. This comes as OpenAI plans significant infrastructure spending and Nvidia seeks to deploy its GPUs.

title: 'Intellectual terrorists more dangerous': Cops on Delhi 2020 riots; flag worrying trend
content: Delhi Police informed the Supreme Court that "intellectuals becoming terrorists" pose a greater danger. They argued that activists Umar Khalid and Sharjeel Imam, among others, are using trial delays to their advantage. The police presented evidence of "inflammatory speeches" and alleged the riots were timed with Donald Trump's visit to spark nationwide unrest and achieve "regime change."

title: Gold and silver ETFs losing shine — Should you buy on dip or hold back?
content: Gold and silver ETFs experienced a significant downturn, with gold down over 6% and silver nearly 9%. Experts advise a long-term perspective and systematic investment plans (SIPs) to navigate volatility. While gold is seen as a debt alternative, silver's long-term potential is viewed as weaker. Despite recent dips, both metals show strong historical returns.

title: Crisis in Pakistan cricket! Former cricketer resigns from selection panel
content: Former Pakistan Test captain Azhar Ali has stepped down from the national selection committee and head of youth development at the Pakistan's National Cricket Academy. He resigned after Sarfaraz Ahmed was given full control of the Pakistan Shaheens and under-19 teams. Azhar reportedly grew frustrated with the board's functioning and proposals not being advanced.

title: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella to employees: Must rapidly rethink AI
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella has appointed Rolf Harms, the executive behind the influential 2010 "Economics of the Cloud" white paper, to help rethink Microsoft's business model for the AI era. In an internal memo obtained by Business Insider, Nadella emphasized the need to rapidly transform the company's approach to AI economics, similar to its cloud computing pivot 15 years ago. The move reflects Nadella's concerns about Microsoft's survival in the AI era, as he warned employees that some of the company's biggest businesses may become irrelevant without fundamental changes.

title: Ex-NFL star Antonio Brown investigated for attempted murder
content: Former NFL star Antonio Brown emerged from a Miami correctional center, facing attempted murder charges. Prosecutors and his defense attorney expressed doubts about the alleged victim being shot, potentially impacting the case. Brown, who pleaded not guilty, was granted house arrest with a GPS monitor, allowing him to work and support his seven children.

title: Technical snag hits IndiGo: Guwahati–Delhi flight delayed by three hours
content: Passengers on IndiGo flight 6E 930 from Guwahati to Delhi faced a significant three-hour delay on Thursday due to a technical snag. Engineers identified the issue, grounding the aircraft at Lokpriya Gopinath Bordoloi International Airport. The airline is offering refreshments and options for refunds or rebooking.

title: IND vs SA | 'Already drink tea during lunch': Sudharsan reacts to change for 2nd Test
content: Team India and South Africa will adopt an unusual practice for the second Test in Guwahati, with play starting 30 minutes early and tea preceding lunch. This adjustment is to accommodate the North East's early daylight window. Players like Sai Sudharsan and Keshav Maharaj are open to the change, while Aiden Markram expresses a preference for the traditional routine.

title: LiAngelo Ball goes platinum with breakout hit 'Tweaker' featuring Drake
content: LiAngelo Ball, formerly a basketball player, has achieved a major milestone in music. His debut single 'Tweaker' has gone platinum. This success signifies a significant crossover from sports to the entertainment industry. The song became a cultural phenomenon, embraced by sports teams and charting highly. Ball's journey redefines his public identity and highlights his artistic ambition.

title: Esports Awards 2025: Ishowspeed wins streamer of the year - full list of winners
content: The Esports Awards 2025 celebrated a decade of competitive gaming in Las Vegas, honoring top players, teams, and creators. YouTube sensation IShowSpeed clinched the prestigious Streamer of the Year award, marking a significant career milestone after his nomination last year. The event recognized excellence across 24 diverse categories, highlighting the industry's vibrant growth.

title: Video sparks allegations of Trevon Diggs’ role in violent elevator encounter
content: Surveillance footage has surfaced regarding an elevator altercation in Los Angeles, allegedly involving individuals connected to the Diggs family. While Trevon Diggs isn't officially charged, a civil suit names him, and his brother Darez has faced legal action. The victim claims robbery and assault, sparking intense scrutiny.

title: 'Sorry mom': 10th student jumps to death; massive protest outside Delhi school
content: A 16-year-old student died by suicide, leaving a note alleging harassment by teachers. The note, found in his school bag, detailed his distress and requested action against the educators. His father's FIR corroborates the claims of continuous mental torment over minor issues, prompting protests by students and parents demanding accountability.

title: Fresh Gen-Z protests erupt in Nepal: Clashes in Bara, Simara; curfew imposed
content: Gen Z demonstrators clashed with police in Nepal's Bara district for a second day, leading to a curfew imposition. Tensions escalated after an alleged attack on youths by CPN-UML cadres, with Gen Z demanding arrests and vowing to keep the district closed. Interim Prime Minister Sushila Karki urged restraint ahead of the 2026 elections.

title: Bihar: 4 of 5 seats with max & min SIR deletions won by NDA; why EC datasets don’t fit into pattern
content: While women's turnout significantly boosted the NDA's Bihar victory, AIMIM secured three of the top five seats with highest female participation. The special revision exercise's impact on poll outcomes showed mixed results, with NDA winning a proportional share of seats affected by deletions and additions.

title: Sundar Pichai says AI could replace him: Is the CEO 'easier' to automate?
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai foresees AI taking over complex tasks, even his own job, within a year. This aligns with other tech leaders like OpenAI's Sam Altman, though Nvidia's CEO disagrees. While AI excels at data-driven decisions and strategy modeling, human judgment, trust-building, and ethical reasoning remain irreplaceable leadership qualities.

title: 4 early warning signs of colorectal cancer that appear in poop
content: Colorectal cancer is a serious health issue, affecting more young people. Early detection is vital for survival. Changes in stool, like thinness, mucus, or blood, can be warning signs. Persistent changes in bowel habits also require attention. Lifestyle factors contribute to the rising risk. Prompt medical evaluation is essential.

title: India’s playing XI puzzle: No Gill, Sudharsan, NKR in mix; Axar Patel likely to sit out
content: India have been dealt a significant setback ahead of the second Test in Guwahati, with captain Shubman Gill ruled out due to lack of match fitness. Despite travelling with the squad and showing signs of improvement, the BCCI medical team has advised against risking him, forcing India to rethink their Playing XI combinations for the must-win game.

title: Gold price today: How much the yellow metal costs in your city? Check rates
content: Gold and silver prices saw a decline in futures trade as the US Federal Reserve's meeting minutes indicated continued caution regarding interest rate cuts. Analysts noted that market uncertainty increased following the unexpected cancellation of the October employment report, impacting rate-cut expectations and strengthening the Dollar Index.

title: Signature 'gamcha' returns: PM Modi’s wave steals show in Patna - Watch
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi was seen waving his signature gamcha at Nitish Kumar's swearing-in ceremony in Patna, marking the latter's record 10th term as Bihar Chief Minister. PM Modi congratulated the new government and thanked the people of Bihar for the NDA's significant mandate.

title: Robert Vadra case: ED files chargesheet in money-laundering probe
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has filed a chargesheet naming Robert Vadra in a money-laundering case linked to UK-based defence dealer Sanjay Bhandari. The complaint, submitted before Delhi’s Rouse Avenue Court, follows Vadra’s PMLA statement recorded in July. Earlier, the ED charged him in a Rs 58-crore Gurgaon land deal case, naming 11 additional accused.

title: Savannah James gets emotional as daughter Zhuri joins SZN Volleyball team
content: Savannah James celebrated her daughter Zhuri Nova's milestone as she begins her volleyball journey with the popular SZN team. Despite her family's basketball background, Zhuri Nova chose a different athletic path. The proud mother shared heartwarming clips and reflected on Zhuri Nova's 11th birthday, highlighting her daughter's intelligence and confidence.

title: Why are tomato prices soaring? Retail prices shoot up 50% - here’s what’s driving the rise
content: Tomato prices have surged significantly, with retail prices rising by 25% to 100% in the last month due to reduced supply caused by excessive rainfall. Wholesale prices in key supply regions like Maharashtra and Delhi have also seen substantial increases.

title: IND vs SA: 'Pitches hurting their own batters' - Ponting warns India after Kolkata loss
content: Ricky Ponting takes a critical stance on the pitch conditions in Kolkata, arguing that the extreme turning nature of the surface is counterproductive for India's own batting lineup. He endorses Rishabh Pant as the ideal choice for captain in the upcoming Test, highlighting Pant's vast experience in the IPL.

title: With issue of a draft form, USCIS takes first step towards launch of the 'Gold Card' program
content: The USCIS has taken a preliminary step towards a 'Gold Card' program, allowing wealthy foreign nationals to gain permanent residency through significant government donations. A draft application form has been submitted for review, outlining donation requirements of $1 million for individuals and $2 million for corporations, with a $15,000 application fee.

title: Rs 415 cr fraud: Al-Falah University dupes students; how to check institute's accreditation
content: Al-Falah University’s ₹415-crore ‘dupe’ scandal has exposed how easily institutions can mislead students with fake grades, expired approvals and inflated credibility. As investigations widen from terror links to accreditation fraud, families are left asking how to protect their children. This guide explains where to check a college’s approvals, how to read accreditation claims, and the red flags every applicant must watch.

title: 'Nirantar' Nitish Kumar: Why 'Sushasan Babu' remains Bihar's most indispensable leader
content: Nitish Kumar secures an unprecedented tenth term as Bihar's Chief Minister, demonstrating remarkable political resilience. Despite numerous alliance shifts and criticisms, he has once again swept the state, shattering notions of age-related fatigue. His consistent victory, attributed to strategic governance and welfare initiatives, solidifies his position as a dominant force in Bihar's politics.

title: Record alert! A feat no Indian has achieved: Mushfiqur Rahim joins elite club
content: Mushfiqur Rahim achieved a rare cricketing feat, scoring a century in his 100th Test, a milestone no Indian has reached. The Bangladeshi veteran's emotional hundred against Ireland cemented his place in an elite club of legends. His innings provided crucial stability for Bangladesh, marking a historic moment for the nation's cricket.

title: 'You are so lucky': Trump teases Musk during dinner with Saudi Crown Prince; Tesla CEO’s response
content: Elon Musk offered thanks to Donald Trump hours after the former US President publicly highlighted his past support for Musk's ventures. Trump recalled assistance during his time in government and tax credits for electric vehicle purchases. This exchange followed a White House dinner attended by Musk, Trump, and Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman.

title: Trump’s tariff exemptions for 200 goods: How agro exports will benefit from US move
content: The US has removed tariffs on over 200 food items, including tea, coffee, and spices. This move is expected to boost Indian agricultural exports, creating a more level playing field. Indian exporters anticipate increased demand and better market access.

title: Tech firm whose founder beat Musk as world's richest for a day loses 30% market value
content: Larry Ellison briefly surpassed Elon Musk in wealth after a surge in Oracle's stock, driven by a massive OpenAI cloud deal. However, Oracle's value has since plummeted, erasing those gains and leaving Musk firmly back in the top spot. Investors are now cautious about Oracle's AI-dependent strategy and high valuations.

title: Hardik Pandya's injury update: Comeback delayed; set to miss ODI series vs SA
content: Hardik Pandya’s return to competitive cricket has been pushed back by a few days, ruling him out of the upcoming ODI series against South Africa. The all-rounder, who was initially expected to rejoin Baroda for the early rounds of the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy, will now link up with his state side only at the end of the month, which is part of a carefully managed comeback plan after nearly two months on the sidelines.

title: 'Failed to explain to people of Bihar': Prashant Kishor holds 'maun vrat'
content: Jan Suraaj supremo Prashant Kishor observed a day-long maun vrat at Bihar's Bhitiharwa Gandhi Ashram following his party's electoral defeat. Kishor took full responsibility for the Jan Suraaj's poor performance, vowing to work harder to fulfill his resolve to improve Bihar.  Meanwhile, Nitish Kumar was sworn in as Chief Minister for a record tenth time.

title: Return of kingmaker: Nitish sworn in as Bihar CM - list of ministers who took oath
content: At a vibrant ceremony, Nitish Kumar was officially sworn in as Chief Minister of Bihar for the 10th occasion, with Prime Minister Narendra Modi in attendance to witness the momentous occasion. This inauguration heralds the establishment of a new NDA government following their sweeping success in the 2025 Assembly elections.

title: PhysicsWallah stock slide: Shares sink for 3rd day as Rs 8,600cr wiped out since debut
content: PhysicsWallah's post-listing surge has evaporated, with shares plummeting over 9% and erasing billions in market value. Despite the sharp decline, the edtech firm still trades above its IPO price. Experts cite strong fundamentals like brand recall and affordability, but caution against competition and regulatory risks.

title: IND vs SA: Shubman Gill yet to return to nets; green tinge Guwahati surface under spotlight
content: Preparations for the second Test in Guwahati are underway, with the Barsapara Cricket Stadium pitch showing a green tinge. Shubman Gill, recovering from a neck spasm, may join practice tomorrow. The red soil pitch is expected to offer pace and bounce, aiming for a balanced surface after Kolkata's criticism.

title: Bryce Dunlap’s sudden death leaves fans with unanswered questions and grief
content: Bryce Dunlap, a 21-year-old Cleveland Browns fan, died from an anoxic brain injury following a sudden respiratory and cardiac emergency. His family honored his wish to donate organs, leading to a successful liver transplant for former Browns quarterback Bernie Kosar. The community has rallied in support, exceeding fundraising goals for his memorial.

title: Not a 1st-timer: Another Al-Falah grad wanted in 2008 serial blasts; now in Pak
content: Mirza Shadab Baig, a key accused in the 2008 Delhi and Ahmedabad serial bombings, remains at large and is believed to be in Pakistan. Baig, who headed the Azamgarh module of the Indian Mujahideen, was instrumental in merging terror groups and conducting recce operations. His network linked both serial bombings, which resulted in numerous casualties.

title: Global Liquor Giants Seek Rs 2,985 Crore Payment From Telangana
content: Alcohol industry groups representing Heineken, Diageo and Pernod Ricard have urged the southern Indian state of Telangana to settle $337 million in overdue payments, saying further delay risks supply shortages and threatens business continuity, a let

title: "Hurts My Heart": Trump's Split With Marjorie Taylor Greene Leaves MAGA Camp Stunned
content: Greene, who has been one of the most prominent voices in the MAGA movement, has not shirked from criticising her own party or taking on Trump directly over the Epstein scandal, foreign policy, healthcare costs or the government shutdown.

title: "Historic Milestone": Indian-Born Cheetah Gives Birth To 5 Cubs At Kuno National Park
content: Indian-born cheetah Mukhi has given birth to five cubs at Kuno National Park in Madhya Pradesh, officials said on Thursday.

title: An Antarctic Milestone That Echoes Adani Group Backing Of India's Achievers
content: Dr Rishi Raj, Additional General Manager (Operations) at DMRC, was accompanied by Sanjeev Kumar, Chief Station Controller at DMRC and a former Indian Navy serviceman. Kumar played a key role in the ceremonial hoisting of the Indian flag on the icy co

title: Odisha Driver Suffers Heart Attack While Driving Bus, Stops Safely, Dies
content: The driver of a bus of the Odisha State Road Transport Corporation (OSRTC) died on Thursday after suffering a heart attack while driving on the Koraput-Sunabeda stretch, police said.

title: 'BLOs Operating Beyond Human Limits': Mamata Banerjee To Poll Body Chief
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee wrote to the Chief Election Commissioner of India, Gyanesh Kumar, on Thursday, urging him to halt the ongoing Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of the electoral rolls in the state, citing "inhuman" work

title: Musk's Previous Pay Package Can Shave Off Years Of Tesla Profits
content: Tesla's gaudy $1 trillion executive-compensation package for CEO Elon Musk has obscured a more pressing concern: Musk's 2018 pay package, still tied up in court, could eat up years' worth of the electric vehicle maker's future profits.

title: Ukraine Receives 1,000 Bodies Of Soldiers From Russia
content: Ukraine said Thursday it had received from Russia the bodies of 1,000 people that Moscow said were killed Ukrainian soldiers, in the latest repatriation between the two sides.

title: After Israel's Fresh Strikes On Gaza, Qatar Warns Of 'Dangerous Escalation'
content: Gaza health authorities said fresh Israeli air strikes killed four people Thursday as Qatar, a mediator of the weeks-long ceasefire, warned that renewed attacks threatened to undermine the fragile truce between Israel and Hamas.

title: Does Russian President Vladimir Putin Use AI? What Kremlin Said
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin does not use artificial intelligence tools himself, but officials who work for him do, the Kremlin said on Thursday.

title: 'Deepfake' Of Ex Army Chief's NDTV Interview Circulated By Pak Accounts
content: Pakistani propaganda accounts ran a deep fake version of NDTV's Shiv Aroor's interview of General VP Malik (retired) and made the former Indian Army chief sound communal using words he had never spoken.

title: US Elections LIVE Updates: Zohran Mamdani Calls New York 'Light In Political Darkness' In First Speech
content: US Mayoral Election 2025 LIVE: In the United States, New York City, New Jersey, Virginia, and California are voting in the first major Election Day since President Donald Trump returned to the White House.

title: Bihar Assembly Elections Phase 1 Highlights: 64% Turnout Recorded, Highest In 73 Years
content: The first phase of the Bihar assembly polls saw several senior political figures cast their votes early on Thursday. Among the early voters were RJD leader and INDIA bloc Chief Minister candidate Tejashwi Yadav

title: Delhi Blast Updates: Two Gates Of Red Fort Metro Station Reopen Days After Explosion
content: Thirteen people were killed and many others injured after a car driven by a doctor at Al-Falah University exploded near the Red Fort Metro Station on Monday.

title: Delhi Blast Highlights: Anti-Terror Agency Arrests Delhi Suicide Bomber's Accomplice
content: It has been nearly a week since the blast near the Red Fort in Delhi killed 13 people and injured many others. The explosion happened at 6.52 pm on Monday in a white coloured Hyundai i20 driven by a Kashmiri doctor, Umar Mohammad, alias Umar Nabi.

title: 'Hope They Fulfil Promises': Tejashwi Yadav's 1st Remarks After Bihar Poll Drubbing
content: In his first comments after his party's drubbing in the Bihar elections, RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav has congratulated JDU leader Nitish Kumar for taking oath as the chief minister and said he hopes the new government will fulfil expectations.

title: Reforms Drive India's Defence Production To Record Rs 1.54 Lakh Crore
content: India recorded its highest-ever defence production of Rs 1.54 lakh crore in 2024-25, with manufacturing in the country rising leaps and bounds over the past years, thanks to the right policies and Atmanirbharta reforms in place.

title: "Intellectuals More Dangerous": Police To Top Court On 2020 Riots Accused
content: While arguing against the bail petitions by 2020 Delhi riots accused Sharjeel Imam, Umar Khalid and other accused, the Delhi Police compared them to terrorists behind the November 10 Red Fort blast which killed 13 people.

title: Meta To Pay $550 Million To Spanish Media Outlets For 'Unfair Competition'
content: A court in Spain said Thursday it has ordered Facebook owner Meta to pay local media outlets 479 million euros ($552 million) in compensation for "unfair competition" plus 60 million euros in interest.

title: Paris Wax Museum Installs Statue Of Princess Diana In Famous 'Revenge Dress'
content: The Grevin waxwork museum in Paris unveiled a new star attraction on Thursday: Princess Diana in the "revenge dress" she wore after public revelations about her then-husband Prince Charles's infidelity.

title: Hurts unfazed by reports Eagles frustrated with QB
content: Eagles quarterback Jalen Hurts, responding to recent reports that some players have grown frustrated with his play, says he will "never run away" from holding himself accountable.

title: UConn 'got punked' as Arizona overwhelms in paint
content: Arizona flipped the script on UConn in their top-five matchup, taking advantage of senior center Tarris Reed Jr.'s absence to win a physical battle in the paint during a 71-67 victory.

title: Braves retain Iglesias, deal for Gold Glover Dubon
content: The Braves retained veteran closer Raisel Iglesias on a one-year, $16 million deal and acquired two-time Gold Glove winner Mauricio Dubon from the Astros.

title: Lamar on injury report again, this time for ankle
content: For the second straight week, Lamar Jackson didn't practice for the Ravens on Wednesday. This time, the two-time NFL MVP is listed with an ankle injury.

title: Rodgers: Playing status will be 'a safety thing'
content: To play Sunday against the Bears, Steelers quarterback Aaron Rodgers said he has to be able to "protect" himself.

title: Jets' Boyd: 'Starting to breathe on my own now'
content: Jets cornerback Kris Boyd, who was shot in the abdomen early Sunday morning outside a Manhattan restaurant, is now in stable condition and "starting to breathe on my own now," he said Wednesday.

title: Terps get Oladotun, Williams' 1st 5-star since '17
content: Babatunde Oladotun, ranked No. 8 in the SC Next 100 for the class of 2026, committed to Maryland on Wednesday, giving coach Buzz WIlliams his first five-star recruit in nearly a decade.

title: Top seeds now set for World Cup draw, playoffs
content: The top-seeded teams for the Dec. 5 World Cup tournament draw, including Germany but not Croatia, were set Wednesday when FIFA published new rankings.

title: 📸 Cardi B, Stefon Diggs share photo of newborn
content: The Grammy Award-winning artist and girlfriend of the New England Patriots wide receiver announced their child's birth on Instagram.

title: Early trade deadline questions: What's next for Giannis, Lakers and top contenders?
content: Early NBA trade deadline questions for Bucks, Lakers, Warriors and other top contenders, including biggest needs and what they can pull off.

title: Jimmy Butler, Steve Kerr and the Warriors' quest to solve the Jonathan Kuminga puzzle
content: Butler has taken on a mentorship role with Kuminga, who is still trying to find his role with the Warriors.

title: Barnwell: Is Nick Sirianni the most scrutinized successful coach in NFL history?
content: The Eagles' head coach is 56-22 over five seasons, including two trips to the Super Bowl. Yet he's constantly under the microscope. Why?

title: 'You don't want to have the same drip': How a Houston Christian receiver became a shoe artist to the stars
content: Why Travis Hunter, Jeremiah Smith and Caitlin Clark have custom shoes from this Houston Christian freshman.

title: Week 13 preview: Top breakout players, key conference matchups and more
content: Our college football experts tell us what's at stake in key conference matchups, plus breakout players and more.

title: Meet the REAL Derek Stingley Jr., the Texans' QB-baiting shutdown corner
content: Stingley has 14 interceptions since 2022, but he doesn't want to talk about them. He is much more interested in the plays he almost made.

title: Projecting Round 1 of next year's NFL draft: Miller finds landing spots for 32 top prospects
content: How early could Ty Simpson go? What about Makai Lemon, David Bailey and Mansoor Delane? Let's project Round 1 of the 2026 draft -- plus two trades.

title: Your guide to women's college basketball Feast Week: 36 games to watch over the next 10 days
content: From the Players Era in Las Vegas to Bahamas tournaments, the next 10 days are filled with big nonconference games.

title: Grading preseason bold predictions for all 32 NHL teams
content: Some of our wild takes from September don't look so wild anymore. Others are way off-base. Here's an update.

title: $400 million extension, blockbuster trade or let it ride? MLB insiders break down Tigers' Tarik Skubal options
content: Will the best pitcher in baseball be on the move this offseason? Those in the game offer their advice.

title: How a baseball behemoth plans to get better? 3 questions as Dodgers eye three-peat
content: L.A.'s blueprint to bolster a two-time defending champion will be among MLB's biggest stories this winter.

title: Fixing what's wrong with Liverpool, Barcelona, Juventus, more
content: We've all read the narratives around teams like Liverpool and Barcelona, who have clear issues. But what do the stats say? And what's actually going wrong? Let's look at some clubs with notable worries, and what could be done.

title: Reranked: Who is the MVP for each of the top Premier League clubs?
content: Based on a combination of ability and tactical importance, we look at the best players among the Big Six teams.

title: Why we're about to find out if Al Davis was right about Lane Kiffin
content: In different circumstances, Kiffin could -- maybe even should -- leave Ole Miss. But not these circumstances.

title: Buzz around the NFL: Will Burrow or Daniels be back on the field? Which coaches are on hot seat?
content: Will Joe Burrow and Jayden Daniels play again this season? Are the Vikings worried about J.J. McCarthy? And which coaches are on the hot seat?

content: Breaking down top class of 2026 commitments, including former 2027 No. 1 Babatunde Oladotun to Maryland.

content: Breaking down fits of every top 2026 commitment, including Texas' third pick-up in the early signing window.

content: As LeBron James begins his record-setting 23rd season in the NBA, here are the four biggest questions to answer.

title: Lakers center Deandre Ayton shares story of LeBron throwing him lob in 2014
content: Deandre Ayton reveals that it was second time he has been on receiving end of an alley-oop from James.

title: 'From underdog to star,' Riley Tiernan breaks through in the NWSL
content: Two weeks before the season, the Rookie of the Year nominee didn't even know whether she'd make a team.

title: Russo belongs at No. 9 if Arsenal hope to revive their UWCL campaign
content: Alessia Russo boasts many qualities, but her brace vs. Real Madrid showed just how valuable she is as Arsenal's primary goal threat.

title: Ranked: All 64 national teams that can still win the 2026 World Cup after latest eliminations
content: There are still 64 national teams that can win the FIFA World Cup next summer. Let's go through them all and rank where they stand.

content: Even Jonathan Taylor can't do it all by himself. Fantasy managers have a role to play too.  Here's what to do.

content: An all-encompassing look at matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores.

title: Why Haney is in an unusual spot heading into the Norman fight
content: Devin Haney is only 26, a pound-for-pound talent and unbeaten. So why is he facing a crossroads fight against Brian Norman Jr.?

title: The running man: Josh Allen on cusp of QB history
content: The Buffalo Bills' MVP is one rushing TD away from becoming the NFL's all-time leader in rushing TDs by a QB. Will he get it Thursday?

title: Case registered against vehicle driver, owner for ‘flouting norms’ in Tirumala
content: Check-post staffer at Alipiri removed from duty for allowing the vehicle with sticker of an alien faith to motor up to Tirumala

title: Madras High Court stays action initiated by women’s commission against AIADMK MP
content: Justice A.D. Jagadish Chandira grants the interim stay on a writ petition filed by the MP alleging that a motivated complaint has been lodged against him before the TNSCW due to political reasons

title: Madras High Court will no longer hear interim bail pleas of convicts awaiting government decision on premature release
content: The practice of granting interim bail in such matters had been in vogue in the High Court since 2016. Justices N. Sathish Kumar and M. Jothiraman directed to put an end to the “impermissible” practice.

title: Mount pressure on Centre to halt VSP privatisation, CPI leader Eswaraiah urges Chandrababu Naidu
content: Seeking allocation of captive mines to VSP, the CPI State secretary criticises the State government for offering major incentives to private players, while neglecting the PSU

title: Halt efforts to take up Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls in Andhra Pradesh, parties urge Chief Electoral Officer
content: The administrative machinery has already begun the groundwork though Andhra Pradesh does not find mention in the ECI notification, they allege

title: TMC MP questions UIDAI list of ‘deactivated’ Aadhaar numbers in Bengal
content: UIDAI claimed that 32.8 lakh Aadhaars were deactivated based on the death reported by West Bengal government.

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Tenant farmers in Andhra Pradesh cry foul over ‘denial’ of Annadata Sukhibhava benefit
content: They appeal to  the government to extend financial assistance of ₹20,000 per tenant farmer family under the scheme, as promised in the run-up to the elections

title: Belgium's Supreme Court to hear Mehul Choksi's appeal against extradition on December 9
content: Mehul Choksi has challenged before Belgium's top court an October 17 ruling of the Antwerp Court of Appeal that upheld India's request for his extradition while terming it "enforceable"

title: Uttar Pradesh court fixes November 27 as next date of hearing in Hathras stampede case
content: Police have named Bhole Baba's aide Devprakash Madhukar and 10 others as accused, holding them responsible for the tragedy. All of them are currently out on bail

title: Sabarimala gold theft case: SIT arrests former TDB president A. Padmakumar
content: A member of the Pathanamthitta district committee of the Communist Party of India (Marxist) and a former MLA, he is the eighth accused in the case

title: After hiatus following Karur stampede, Vijay likely to resume TVK rally at Salem in December
content: The police denied permission for a rally on December 4 as it is the eve of the Karthigai Deepam festival

title: Tourists banned from hill stations in Chikkamagaluru district in Karnataka due to Datta Jayanti
content: However, the ban would not apply to the local people and those who had booked homestays and resorts well in advance

title: A.P. to integrate globally recognised Finnish learning models into its education system
content: Student welfare and equity form the foundation of Finnish education, schooling and meals are free for all students, and the system prioritises formative assessments over standardised testing, Principal Secretary Human Resources Development said

title: Mamata writes to CEC, alleges SIR 'unplanned', 'coercive'
content: Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee claimed that the SIR exercise has reached an "alarming" and "dangerous" stage

title: Delhi Red Fort blast case: NIA arrests four more prime accused
content: Delhi Court sent the four accused to 10 days of NIA custody; the four accused were previously held by the J&K Police for the suspected links with a “terror” module.

title: Opinion in President Reference is advisory while Supreme Court’s T.N. Governor case judgment is binding
content: The Reference was made a little over a month after a Division Bench of the Supreme Court, in a judgment in the Tamil Nadu Governor’s case in April, fixed three-month timelines for the Governors and the President to decide on State Bills sent to them for assent or reserved for her consideration, respectively

title: Tamil Nadu, ANSR sign MoU to attract more Global Capability Centres
content: “Through this partnership, ANSR will help bring in the next wave of global corporations. We will support them with policy enablement, fast approvals, site selection, and strong talent linkages,” said Minister T.R.B. Rajaa

title: Fast break: Insights on Donovan Mitchell, Reed Sheppard, Shaedon Sharpe and more
content: Eric Moody's fantasy basketball insights you need to know about, including Donovan Mitchell's heavier workload, along with more on Reed Sheppard, Dyson Daniels and Shaedon Sharpe.

title: How will 2026 halftime stack up with the most searched Super Bowl shows?
content: Bad Bunny's Super Bowl set drawing buzz, but search data shows which halftime shows stood the test of time.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United eye highly rated Rennes duo
content: Manchester United are keeping tabs on Rennes duo Jérémy Jacquet and Mohamed Meite. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Bihar's double-engine govt will work with more energy to realise PM's vision: Amit Shah
content: This double-engine government will work with even more energy to realise the vision of Prime Minister Narendra Modi ji's 'Developed Bihar' and to reach development works to all sections of society, says Union Home Minister Amit Shah

title: Kashmir Times editors say SIA raids intended to intimidate, delegitimise, ultimately to silence
content: Editors of the Kashmir Times assert that ongoing police raids and unfounded allegations against them are part of a broader effort to stifle independent journalism

title: Nepal facilitates help for hydropower projects by Indian companies
content: The meeting, chaired by Prime Minister Sushila Karki, on Wednesday decided to extend the date of the survey license for the reservoir-based West Seti hydropower project

title: Conservationists raise concern over rising roadkill in the Nilgiris
content: According to conservationists, the stretches where roadkill has become a major problem are along the Udhagamandalam-Kotagiri road and the Ooty-Gudalur road

title: Meeting Centre’s deadline to make Andhra free from left-wing extremism by March 2026: DGP Harish Kumar Gupta
content: “CPI (Maoist) general secretary Devuji is not in our custody; the Operation Sambhav has eliminated key Maoists in the two encounters in Maredumilli agency,” DGP said

title: Telangana CM discusses collaboration opportunities with Analog AI CEO
content: Analog AI was keen on addressing issues like traffic congestion, urban flooding and climate change prediction for Hyderabad city using their cutting edge tech platforms, said the CEO

title: LJP(RV)'s rise fulfils father's dream, says Chirag Paswan after two party MLAs take oath as Ministers
content: Today is a day to remember Ram Vilas Paswan ji and to work towards developing Bihar. It is a big day, and on this day, I first remember my leader and my father, the respected Ram Vilas Paswan ji, says Chirag Paswan

title: Telangana’s Wanaparthy Collector increases senior citizen allowance when ₹5,000 was not paid by their children
content: In some cases, Wanaparthy Collector issued orders to pay double of the ̥Rs. 5,000 allowance earlier ordered to pay

title: Sabarimala gold theft case: SIT questioning former TDB president A. Padmakumar
content: Though there is no official confirmation on the proceedings, it is suspected that Padmakumar’s arrest may be recorded after the interrogation

title: After Kerala HC order, Travancore Devaswom Board caps Sabarimala spot bookings at 5,000 per day
content: While spot booking will be available at Nilackal and Vandiperiyar, booking centres at Pampa, Erumely, and Chengannur have been suspended. Restrictions on spot bookings will remain in place till November 24

title: Citizen scientists track the pond herons mysterious night flights on India’s East coast
content: New citizen-science data from Visakhapatnam suggests that pond herons and cattle egrets may be undertaking regular seasonal journeys along the East coast, reviving a 30-year-old mystery from Chennai

title: Three killed, four injured as speeding car crashes into truck in MP’s Guna district
content: The other two injured persons are being treated at the Guna district hospital. The deceased have been identified as Akash (22), Namo Narayan (24) and Manish Jatav (25).

title: Redeveloped flower markets at Gandhi Bazaar and Malleswaram in Bengaluru to open soon with Multi Level Car Parking
content: While the two MLCPs in traditional market hubs of Bengaluru, where parking is a crisis, is a welcome addition, a question mark remains over their efficacy

title: Maredumilli encounter: Families claim mortal remains of Madvi Hidma, his wife Raje
content: Alluri Sitarama Raju District Superintendent of Police Amit Bardar told The Hindu, “The post-mortem has been conducted in Rampachodavaram Area Hospital”

title: Traffic police propose new tech for Multi Level Car Parking at 66 places in Bengaluru
content: This follows a recent meeting over the parking crisis in Bengaluru, and directions issued to BTP and civic officials to come up with solutions for the same

title: Watch: Is the SIR 2.0 deadline realistic? Here’s why officials disagree
content: India’s Special Intensive Revision is updating voter rolls after nearly two decades, but the nationwide drive has sparked protests and intense pressure on booth-level officers. This explainer unpacks why the Election Commission is racing against time and how overworked officials say the process is pushing them to the brink.

title: Nitish Kumar sworn in as Bihar CM, 26 Ministers take oath, including one Muslim and three women
content: Altogether, 26 Cabinet Ministers took oath, out of which 14 are from BJP, eight from JD(U), two from LJP (RV) and one each from HAM (S) and RLM

title: Bengaluru ATM cash van robbery: Gang switched vehicles, says Karnataka Home Minister
content: The robbery took place on November 19 afternoon when the accused, posing as RBI officials, intercepted a CMS cash van near Jayanagar and escaped with ₹7.11 crore in cash

title: Prashant Kishor undertakes silent fast at Gandhi Ashram in Bihar
content: He had chosen the same spot three years ago for launching a 3,500 km-long "pada yatra" that culminated in the formation of Jan Suraaj Party

title: Delhi riots case hearing updates: Intellectual terrorists more dangerous than ground level ones, ASG argues for Delhi Police
content: Additional Solicitor General S.V. Raju, appearing for Delhi Police, said it had become a trend now for doctors and engineers to engage in anti-national activities

title: More than 50% pending cases before Justice Juvenile Board; JJBs not fully staffed
content: The IJR filed more than 250 RTI requests and responses from 21 States, revealing that as of October 31, 2023, JJBs had only disposed of less than half of the 1,00,904 cases

title: Remarks against Army: Supreme Court extends stay on trial court proceedings against Rahul Gandhi
content: The Bench was hearing Rahul Gandhi’s plea challenging a May 29 order of the Allahabad High Court dismissing his plea challenging the trial court’s summoning order in the case

title: University of Liverpool to set up campus at Alembic City near Whitefield in Bengaluru, admissions open
content: For the first batch, the university will offer under-graduate programmes in Computer Science, Business Management, Accounting and Finance, Biomedical Sciences, and Game Design

title: Presidential Reference: Supreme Court’s responses to President Murmu’s 14 questions
content: Here is how the Bench responded, in its 111-page opinion, to the 14 questions from President Droupadi Murmu in a Reference issued by her on May 13, 2025

title: Kumbh authority gives administrative approval for Nashik airport expansion; target March 2027
content: The airport, managed by the HAL, will be able to accommodate 1,000 passengers per hour after the expansion

title: Metro Rail proposals for Coimbatore, Madurai have discrepancies: Union Minister
content: Manohar Lal Khattar accused Chief Minister M.K. Stalin of polticising the Union government’s rejection of the Metro Rail project proposals

title: Severe setback to India's diplomacy: Congress on U.S. panel's 'Pakistan success' claim in report
content: The 2025 Annual Report is almost 800 pages long. The sections on pages 108 and 109 are simply astonishing and beyond understanding. It describes the Pahalgam terror attack of April 2025, orchestrated by Pakistan as an 'insurgent attack', says Congress leader Jairam Ramesh in a post on X

title: U.S. approves $92.8 million deal to supply Javelin missiles, Excalibur projectiles to India
content: The deals to purchase the projectiles and missiles come three days after India announced the conclusion of the first-ever long-term deal where Indian oil companies would import American LPG into the country

title: Photographic art book ‘Hampi: The Rituals of Time’ by Saibal Das launched in Bengaluru
content: H. K. Patil said Saibal Das’s book captures the rich heritage, culture and archaeology of Hampi, bringing alive an ancient civilization that was once the cynosure of all eyes

title: Presidential Reference hearings saw SC repeat it is not expected to 'overrule’ T.N. Governor case verdict
content: Incidentally, the Presidential Reference was issued merely a month, on May 13, after a Division Bench headed by Justice J.B. Pardiwala set three-month timelines for the President and the Governors to clear State Bills

title: Trump claims he threatened India, Pakistan with 350% tariffs if they didn't end conflict; ‘Modi, Sharif called me’
content: “I'm not going to have you guys shooting nuclear weapons at each other, killing millions of people and having the nuclear dust floating over Los Angeles,” Trump says he told India and Pakistan

title: CCI moves NCLAT to seek clarification in WhatsApp case
content: In November last year, the CCI imposed a penalty of ₹213.14 crore on social media major Meta with respect to the WhatsApp privacy policy update done in 2021

title: Kerala local body polls: Fed up with neglect, Mundamveli apartment residents to field own candidate
content: Residents of  P&T Apartment Complex at Mundamveli have decided to boycott candidates of all major political fronts contesting from the Mundamveli East division of Kochi Corporation

title: Kerala local body polls: UDF will weaponise govt. policies in civic battle, says E.T. Mohammed Basheer
content: In a candid chat with The Hindu, the Indian Union Muslim League’s national organising secretary and Lok Sabha member from Malappuram asserted that State-level politics, especially the policies of the State government led by Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan, will be the focus of the upcoming elections

title: Kerala local body polls: No clear favourites in southern districts
content: While the ruling LDF, traditionally strong in the region, is seeking to expand its welfare projects, its opposing fronts, UDF and NDA, are inviting voters’ attention to the ‘inadequacies’ in such schemes and other hyper-local concerns

title: Kerala local body polls 2025: A keen contest in the offing in Kalamassery municipality
content: A traditional bastion of the Congress for nearly three decades, the civic body has remained in the UDF kitty. However, in the 2021 byelection the Left front gave the UDF a tough fight

title: From Awadh to Bengal: Old Lucknow to come alive in Kolkata this month
content: The heritage walk, titled Biryani and Beyond, will take place on November 29 and will be essentially a food walk where participants will get to taste traditional but lesser-known delicacies that will be accompanied with stories of migration, culture and cuisine

title: The threat of digital tradecraft in terrorism | Explained
content: A car explosion near Delhi’s Red Fort on November 10, killing at least 15 people and injuring over 30, has revealed the use of advanced digital tradecraft in terrorist attacks. This is a sobering reminder that the next frontier in counter-terrorism is not just on the physical terrain, but also in encrypted, and deeply private digital spaces

title: Presidential Reference updates: SC states it cannot impose timelines on President and Governors, opines concept of ‘deemed assent’ is alien to the Constitution
content: The Bench that heard the Presidential Reference also stated that Governors cannot sit on a Bill endlessly and in cases of prolonged inaction, limited judicial review is permissible

title: Bihar NDA Govt swearing-in highlights: Nitish Kumar takes oath as Bihar Chief Minister for a record 10th time
content: Samrat Choudhary, Vijay Kumar Sinha, Shravan Kumar, other NDA leaders take oath as Bihar Cabinet Ministers

title: New department to connect global Rajasthani diaspora with State’s progress
content: The department would lay down a policy framework to extend the benefits of the government’s schemes to NRRs and strengthen their relations with the State, Rajasthan Minister Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore said

title: Southern Railway launches QR-code grievance system to curb food quality issues
content: The system involves installation of unique QR codes in all the catering stalls; by scanning the QR code passengers are provided with essential details of the stall’s location and the station code

title: Bus tragedy: High-level Indian delegation arrives in Saudi Arabia
content: The delegation, led by Andhra Pradesh Governor Justice S. Abdul Nazeer, arrived in Madina, the Indian Embassy in Riyadh said

title: System constraints holding back probes into cyber attacks: Digital experts
content: India’s loss due to cyber fraud in 2024 surged 205.6% from 2023, cybersecurity experts said at a national conference in Gauhati University

title: Petition in Bombay High Court flags health and safety risks at BMC’s new pigeon feeding site
content: The petition challenges BMC’s interim move to allow controlled pigeon feeding at Airoli-Mulund creekside, citing health hazards and ecological risks.

title: Uttar Pradesh Education Commission faces uproar over repeated delays of TGT examination
content: Aspirants raised concerns that it was the fifth time the examination has been postponed, adding the government system is playing with future of lakhs of candidates, who are jobless and facing a bleak future wasting prime years in the hope of government jobs

title: Shia community representatives demand ticket in BMC election or will vote NOTA
content: The Mumbai Shia Youth Brigade has also written to all political parties on November 16, 2025, raising concerns regarding civic and religious matters

title: The Hindu journalists win Laadli awards for gender-sensitive reportage
content: Reports on the rape and murder of a doctor in R.G. Kar Hospital in Kolkata and a feature on transgender welfare bag accolades

title: Survivor pool strategy: Ravens, Seahawks among top options in Week 12
content: ESPN Eliminator Challenge is one of the most fun games to play this season . the rules are simple: pick one team, and as long as they win (or tie), you advance to the next round . fewer than 6% of entrants were knocked out last week, the lowest rate in any week all season. for the season, only nine underdogs of at least six points have won outright .

title: Anthony Yarde hoping third time's a charm in David Benavidez world title showdown
content: Anthony Yarde was stopped by artur Beterbiev and Sergey Kovalev in 2023 and 2019 respectively . the 34-year-old says he will be better in his third attempt at winning a world light heavyweight title on sunday . he was stopped in eight rounds for three versions of the world title, after lasting 11 rounds .

title: MMA P4P rankings: Shevchenko, Makhachev new No. 1s -- but just one unanimous
content: Valentina Shevchenko was no. 2 on the ESPN men's pound-for-pound rankings . the pair ascended to no. 1 after dominant victories at UFC 322 . Makhachev's opponent, Jack Della Maddalena, was ranked eighth among men .

title: Raid on Kashmir Times office: Cops recover AK rifle cartridges, bullets; editors react
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. The TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape, ensuring that our readers are equipped with the latest developments that matter most." Read More

title: 'Commie' v 'Donnie': Trump to meet Mamdani on Friday at White House — why it matters
content: a frisson of excitement is coursing through Washington DC and New York City . the mayor-elect, the first Indian-origin person voted to administer the global entrepot, has asked for a meeting . 'we have agreed that this meeting will take place at the Oval Office on Friday, November 21st. Further details to follow!'

title: Bracketology: Top seedings, bracket watch and more
content: conference tournaments are set to begin later this week . there are 31 automatic bids with 33 at-large teams chosen by the NCAA volleyball committee . the top eight teams in each region serve as first- and second-round hosts .

title: Best stories, wildest celebrations from amazing round of qualifiers
content: the November international break delivered more than its fair share of thrills and spills as more national teams secured their place at the 2026 finals . the break produced a plethora of qualifying drama as tiny nations reached the finals for the first time, last-minute goals decided matches and a handful of major names tumbled by the wayside .

title: Inside the decision that will rock college football: What's next for Kiffin?
content: coach Lane Kiffin says there is no ultimatum for him to make a decision on his coaching future . he posted a photo of a page from Brianna Wiest's self-development book, "the Pivot Year: 365 days to Become the Person You Truly Want to Be" he encouraged readers to make two lists, one of the positivists .

title: Which 16 teams will make the playoffs? Projections for all 32 at the quarter mark
content: no team in the east was more than four points out of the wild-card spot . in the west, all but three teams were within three points of a playoff spot. this month, we're also looking at points of concern early this season for teams inside and outside the bubble.

title: Texas firmly out, Miami in limbo and the G5’s flavor of the week
content: the new rankings keep Ohio State at the top of the pile, while Texas Tech slides into the no. 5 spot in Week 13 . Notre Dame should buy some furniture and move in . the team's only win against a CFP-ranked team is against no. 15 USC .

title: Updated Power Rankings: 1-32 poll, plus who's under the most pressure for each team
content: we restacked the NFL heading into week 12 . we asked our NFL Nation reporters to pick one player, coach or executive who is under the most pressure for each team . how many picks are the same from when we asked the same question .

title: Alabama and JMU have something in common: anger about the CFP rankings
content: the ACC and the group of 5 will supply champions, too, whether the Big Ten likes it or not . the winner of a week 13 showdown between USC and Oregon should be on track for a bid . it's hard to imagine that Notre Dame is left out, given its no. 9 ranking .

title: What makes Josh Allen so dangerous? Inside his top rushing touchdowns
content: the Buffalo Bills were looking to put away the Tampa Bay Buccaneers in Week 11 . the bills moved the ball to the 9-yard line, leading 37-32 with 2:42 remaining . it was Allen's sixth touchdown and third rushing score of that game .
